dialogue: What are you looking for?
Bobby’s email.
Scroll up--
I’m scrolling.
You’re not scrolling. Look, this is scrolling.
Okay, wait! Wait...
What?
Stop fussing with it.
What’s this?
This is an ad for Neiman Marcus.
Get rid of it.
You don’t have to trash it, it can just stay in your inbox.
Who needs it? What’s an inbox?
It’s... where all of your emails are stored. Like a folder on your computer with all of your emails.
And what is a computer?
...This is a computer--
I know this is a computer but what is it really? How does it function?
It’s-- let’s come back to that.
Yes, there!
Pretty fast.
Very fast. He’s like sixty.
It’s not a stunt man?
No, that’s the whole thing. He does it all himself.
Wow. Terrific.
What’s with you? Big plans tonight?
Nah, just dinging around...
Have you spoken to Allie?
We’re still on a break. I’m trying to give her a little space... And just not really sure what my selling points are at the moment.
Psh! You’re a wonderful grandson. You know computers. You have your hair.
I think it’s gonna start to go early.
You can’t get hung up on that.
We’re just in different places... as people, you know? She’s thinks I’m stuck.
You’re too young to be stuck.
I don’t feel young.
I don’t feel old.
Oy.
Oy is right.
You’re gonna land on your feet. Like Cruise. Who is it they say lands on their feet?
That’s cats. But in a way it could be about both.
You want this? It’s a marble. I have a ton of these.
Sure.
You want pretzels? I have a ton of pretzels.
Only if you don’t need--
Take them! I can’t chew them.
Can you please wear this when I go?
I’m fine.
You probably won’t need it but I’ll feel better if you wear it. Okay?
What’s the point? If I fall, I’m toast. That’s why I don’t fall.
Don’t say that. Come on-- please? For my mental health?
...Only for my guardian angel!
Thank you! Just a precautionary measure.
What’s your plan for the day?
Eh, the usual.
Oh my god...
Hello?
He was going on and on about how you hit someone and it’s worse than you think - she’s pregnant! And--
That I hit a pregnant woman? Like I struck her, with my fist?
No, it was a car accident!
Oh, yes, that makes more sense.
What are you talking about?
Well, it was a close call but it’s over now.
...I’m so embarrassed!
I’ll call you tomorrow. You sure I can’t stay over?
No, no. I’ve got things to do.
For my mental health?
I made a mistake, Teddy.
Hi.
What address?
From the, uh, scam. It was this tiny slip of paper.
You’ll never guess where it turned up--
I can’t hear you that well. It’s going in and out.
On the floor of the bathroom at the post office!
Wait, you went to the post office?
Yah.
How did you get there?
I walked.
That’s far grandma. You shouldn’t have done that.
It’s a few blocks--
You can’t-- you need to tell me if you’re going somewhere so I can take you, okay?
Wha?
You shouldn’t have done that on your own.
But I found it. I have it here--
I know, but maybe it’d be better to just... pause. For now. And we can figure it out together.
What about my money? Am I supposed to just let them have it?
Well, the odds of getting it back are pretty slim, right? The most important thing is that you don’t overdo it. That you’re safe.
I’m sorry about the money. But it could have been a lot worse. Are you okay? You’re at home now?
I’m fine. Yes, I’m home.
If you need to go somewhere, I can take you.
Okay, darling. I appreciate that. Speak soon.

Cynthia? Hi, darling. It’s Thelma Post. I’m afraid I need a bit of a favor. It’s an odd situation-- oh, I’m sorry, Sara. I thought you were Cynthia... She did? How awful. I’m so sorry, dear. No, never mind. Forget I called. All is well. A little later.
Hello, this is Thelma Post calling. Is Harvin there? ...What happened? A stroke. I’m so sorry, Joan. A little later.
A heart attack? A little later.
Sepsis? A little later.
He moved to Cleveland? When did this happen? ...And he’s enjoying the seasons? Well, that’s good. A little later.
Dialysis is no fun. That’s why you don’t wear tight pants around the genitals. Many women have gotten kidney disease that way.
Oh god, I’m calling Cynthia--
Danny? I need a ride.
Just to get this out of the way up top, you were not at home.
All my friends are dead.
What? Don’t say that--

It’s true. They’re all popping off. I used to be in four lunch groups. Who’s left? Judith? She can’t hear anything. And she’s a hunchback now. I wouldn’t want to have lunch with her alone. Herman’s in Canada. Mona doesn’t leave the house. I could invite Lee Horner to join us but I don’t have her number. And Ruth burned up in a fire pit.
I heard about that. ...I’m sorry.
I didn’t expect to get so old.
Well, I’m glad you did. Who do you know here again?
You remember Ben? Ben Halpern? He was married to Sheryl.
Oh yeah, you guys used to see them all the time.
Sheryl was my friend. Ben and Teddy got along well enough. I found him a little soft.
Soft?
I don’t know. Fussy. Sheryl’s dead too. She fell down some stairs in their house. She was there for hours before they found her. Poor thing.
I remember, yeah. So awful.
The car is filthy.
I’m taking good care of it. I’ll clean it.
You won’t clean it. Who raised you?
Your daughter.
Nice try. This is your father’s influence. There’s coins everywhere. They fall out of his pockets because he’s got no waist. Every time I ride with him I make five bucks. What’s this?
That’s my coffee. I’m still drinking it.
It’s important not to let junk accumulate.
I know.
You say that. You don’t know.
When did Judith become a hunchback?
Who knows. A few years ago? You don’t become it all of a sudden. It happens slowly.
You want me to come in?
I’m just saying hello. Won’t be long. 30 minutes.
I’m here if you need me.
Grandma?! Oh my god! Are you alright?! WHAT THE FUCK IS HAPPENING?! SORRY! Are you okay?!
I’m alright, everything’s okay. But I need your help. Now.
Where are you?
I’ll tell you. But you gotta promise me something.
What?
Come alone.
Tell me what you’re looking at.
It’s a family and a baby and they’re everywhere.
Are there words?
It says... Prudential--
It’s an ad. You need to find the x.
There’s no red x.
It’s not always red. Sometimes they hide it. Look closer.
Good! So think of it like a library, right? The search bar, is the librarian.
The search bar is the librarian...
You’re going to ask it for information and it’s going to give it to you--
Where is the bank?
...Are you talking to me?
I’m asking the machine.
She’s not there. Just in your phone. And you don’t need her￾
www.valleyfinancial.com
Hit enter. Thelma runs her fingers over the keys, finds it, and clicks.
I’m in!
What’s the password?
Check the desk.
Oh my god--
What?
The password... is “password.” Harvey scoffs and rolls his eyes.
Classic. Now click inside of that box and type it in. She begins to enter it.
That’s cute.
What?
It wants me to join a gym.
...I’m gonna tell it no.
Good. Remember what we do?
The x. No matter what color.
That’s right. She finds the “x” and closes it. The transfer page fills the screen, boxes waiting to be filled.
I’m in. Be ready in five.
Im assuming it was you on the phone pretending to be Danny. He doesn’t have the range. I’m not your grandma.
He called you a dumbass. He said it quietly but I heard it.
We got it.
...Oh, Danny, you remember Ben?
Hi, Ben. Sorry, yes nice to see you.
Break a leg, Ben!
Does he know what that means?
I’m not sure. He’s new to the theater. And his hip is titanium.
It’s a strange show.
I’m glad to come here. These are good graves. You like them?
As in do I want to be buried in them?
I got a ton of graves.
Oh yeah?
Beautiful graves. Some here. Mostly in New York. My father bought about twelve before he died. Does Allie plan to be buried in a Jewish cemetery?
Oh, wow, I dunno. We haven’t really had the ‘graves conversation’ yet. We’re taking it slow.
We may have enough. You get very greedy. I want to see what’s going to happen to those I love.
I love you. And if you ever do die, I’m really going to miss you. I know you know that. But I just wanted to say it. While we’re here.
Wherever I go, I won’t worry about you. You’re gonna be okay, Danny.
Look! Look at all those bottoms of those trees. Look at how gnarled they are, and yet they live. Look!
I’m looking--
You should be taking photographs of this! Is this unbelievable?
They’re incredible.
I mean, it’s unbelievable. Look at this - this thing is still living. My god!
This tree?
Yes, look at it. It should be down on the ground. It’s unbelievable--
It’s crazy.
What spirit!
